Posts.Content: turnberry wrote: Hi Ladies, Well, I went for my Stereotactic Biopsy on Monday afternoon. Everything there went fine. I got the call yesterday with results. I was hoping for a dx, but I guess these things take much longer than I expected. I was told that I need to go in for an MRI and that they have scheduled an appointment with the breast surgeon for Tuesday. They need to do a surgical biopsy because of abnormal cell growth, atypical hyperplasia, and many changes from my last mammo in Feb. They want more of a tissue sample in order to know how to proceed. They did say that even though they are not calling it cancer right now that just with what they have I would be at a very high risk right now. Given all this information I almost feel as though I just want it out of my body even if it is this Atypical hyperplasia thing. Will I be given any kind of options if that is what it is? I am 37 and have two beautiful children at home that I need to be around for, for along time. I plan on seeing my grandchildren someday and don't want to wait for this to turn into something more. Maybe it is more and I just don't know that yet. Please let me know if anyone has been given options with these types of things. Thanks!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Biopsy to Surgical Biopsy turnberry turnberry

Posts.Content: turnberry wrote: Hi Ladies, Don't know what happened to my last post??  Computer ate it I think. I have a question that I'd like to just throw out there to see if anyone has insight to this.  I have ADH and last year they had suggested I go on Tamoxifen.  I chose not to because my maternal grandmother had a history of blood clots.  Another reason I chose not to was because every single procedure I've had done in regards to my breasts (cyst aspirations, stereotactic biopsy & surgical biopsy) I've developed hematomas.  Now maybe it's just in my mind that blood clots and hematomas are related but does anyone have factual information regarding this.  I go in next week for my 6 mo. follow-up mammo and see the surgeon the next week and I think Tamoxifen might be brought up again at some point.  I just want to know what the risk is. Thanks!!! Sherry Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen risk of blood clots??? turnberry erika-canada

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2007 08:45AM turnberry wrote: Good luck to you, let me know how it turns out. I am going in on Friday for an aspiration and Micro/Mammogram. Talk soon.
Posts.Title: Question? vengle76053 vengle76053

Posts.Content: Feb 20, 2007 07:52AM turnberry wrote: I found a lump in my breast as well in November. Went to the doctor - she didn't seem all that concerned and thought it was just changes with age (Fibrocystic). It seemed to grow over the last couple of monthes so I called to schedule a mammogram. I did have tenderness in the area where the lump was and still is. Had the Mammogram done as well as u/s and they found a large cyst, some small ones and calcifications. Usually cysts can be painful, I'm wondering if maybe its near your sternum which might be cause for the pain. I don't know if that helps at all. Mammorgrams don't show the actual cysts, that is the reason they do the u/s. They usually just show up on the Mammogram as dense areas. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Question? vengle76053 vengle76053

Posts.Content: turnberry wrote: I do have some questions.  I would like to go back to work a week or two after my surgery, I have not yet decided on the type of reconstruction that I will be going with but if I would decide to do expanders to implants, how does that look while in the process?  Do you wear a special bra with prosthetics? Is that possible while you are healing?  How does that feel?  I would not worry about it so much, but I am a receptionist and very visible to our waiting area and some people at work know that I am going through this and it might be awkward having them looking at my chest.  Thanks!! Posts.Content: Jan 3, 2012 03:17PM turnberry wrote: Thanks ladies!!  This certainly gives me some kind of idea of what to expect.  I will be meeting with the general surgeon and ps on Jan. 11th.  I just want to get some kind of idea going into that appt because I want to get this scheduled asap.  I'm thinking that this might be my best option but we will see what the doc has to say.  Nice to also get an idea about how much time I might be off of work.  Did any of you go through the nipple surgery and tatooing yet?  Can you give me any information on that, comfort level, time off work, etc.??  How long after having the transition of expanders to implants?  Thanks again for all your information, its so nice having a place to come to with my concerns:))
Posts.Title: Upcoming BMX surgery ? turnberry barbe1958

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2012 05:22AM turnberry wrote: I feel blessed to have found all of you.  The information that you are giving me is way more than I could find out from any other website, so thanks sooo much for sharing with me.  I live in Rochester, MN which is home of the Mayo Clinic. (Moved here a little over a year ago and had to change over all my care) I do feel confident so far in the care I am receiving, however I haven't yet met my surgeon or ps.  I do know that the surgeon specializes in breast and lymphoma surgery.  I would love to have the one step procedure but I don't think its going to be a viable option for me.  Too many calcifications, cysts and many located right behind the nipple.  I was diagnosed in 2007 with ADH through biopsy and then lumpectomy to remove it.  Now it seems to be showing up in both sides on the mammo along with numerous benign issues that they feel may be covering something else up.  Instead of having multiple biopsies which they pretty much know will have more ADH and possibly more, they are recommending the BMX.  I will not know the final pathology until after the surgery.  I also have a pretty strong family history (sister-treating with chinese herbs and different diet, 2 aunts, 1st cousin) all of which have been in their 40's when diagnosed.  I am 41, was 37 when diagnosed with ADH.  Any other info you would like to share with me is very much appreciated.  I will meet with the surgeons next week and I want to have my list of questions ready for them.  Hugs to all of you!!
Posts.Title: Upcoming BMX surgery ? turnberry barbe1958

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2008 11:22AM turnberry wrote: Hi, I went through a surgical biopsy last year for ADH as well.  Fortunately my breast seems okay.  I'm just curious - did you undergo radiation?  I have heard people that have had ADH sometimes do have radiation but it was never suggested to me.  Unfortunately, the calcifications that were removed are coming back and I go in again in October for yet another mammo and meet with the surgeon.  Good luck with reconstruction!
